quiz.question: What idea does 'You can't have your cake and eat it too' express?
options: You cannot enjoy two mutually exclusive things
quiz.answer: You cannot enjoy two mutually exclusive things

quiz.question: Which Aesop fable inspired the phrase 'sour grapes'?
Which proverb did Shakespeare write in As You Like It, meaning moderation benefits us?
options: Too much of a good thing
Neither a borrower nor a lender be
quiz.answer: Too much of a good thing

quiz.question: Complete: 'Don't cross the bridge until you come to ___'
Which proverb implies the truth becomes obvious through practical testing?
options: The proof of the pudding is in the eating
All is fair in love and war
quiz.answer: The proof of the pudding is in the eating

quiz.question: What is the academic study of proverbs called?
What does 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it' advise?
options: Avoid unnecessary changes to working things
quiz.answer: Avoid unnecessary changes to working things

quiz.question: Which proverb warns not to assume success before it happens?
options: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
quiz.answer: Don't count your chickens before they hatch

quiz.question: Which literary source preserves many aphoristic sayings forming English proverbs, including medieval examples?
Complete the proverb: 'A journey of a thousand miles begins with a ___'
Which proverb did Benjamin Franklin famously popularize?
options: A penny saved is a penny earned
Birds of a feather flock together
quiz.answer: A penny saved is a penny earned

quiz.question: Which proverb did Miguel de Cervantes use in Don Quixote that resembles a modern English saying?
options: The proof of the pudding is in the eating
A stitch in time saves nine
Birds of a feather flock together
quiz.answer: The proof of the pudding is in the eating

quiz.question: What does 'All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy' suggest?
Which proverb means someone cares for their own interests above others'?
Which ancient work contains the line 'Carpe diem' that inspired many modern proverbs?
